item.title: Example batch file to dump Subversion repositories
item.description: Sample batch file to easily dump all Subversion repositories in a single directory.

item.title: Steps to setting up a Windows Server 2003 Web Server on VirtualBox
item.description: Steps to setup a Windows Server 2003 instance running IIS, on VirtualBox.

item.title: Applications I have to install on my core development machine
item.description: Here's a listing of files I need to have installed on my core development machine.

item.title: Parsing iTunes data with C#
item.description: In the quest to better synch iTunes and my iPod, I've been digging into ways to export library information. Here's a test app for Windows, written in C#.

item.title: Formatting drives in Windows Vista
item.description: Why doesn't Vista pop-up a message of some sort when you insert a new drive? [slnet0514:9d375400-ecf0-422b-9aca-b6fa81f20687]

item.description: In this article I'll be installing TortoiseSVN 1.4.8 to a Windows machine, running Vista Ultimate. [slnet0514:ed428114-f660-445d-a5ae-5ef4756fd2b3]

item.title: How to quickly hide all of the Windows Vista Ultimate language packs
item.description: There's no easy way to hide them all, but here's a painless way to hide extraneous Windows Vista Ultimate language packs. [slnet0514:e4b35e21-f82e-43d0-867a-00fc9433fc10]

item.title: Determining which IIS 6.0 Application Pool belongs to which application
item.description: How to match an Application Pool to a process in Windows Server 2003 and IIS 6.0.

item.title: How to ensure that performance counters continue after a restart
item.description: A possible way to have performance counters restart automatically after your box restarts. Also, an example LogParser query to analyze those logs.

item.title: Image thumbnails - blindingly fast on Ubuntu (vs. Windows)?
item.description: Thumbnail images on Windows (from CD) = way too slow.

item.title: Using Disk Investigator to Regain Files
item.description: An exercise showing how to regain lost/deleted files using Disk Investigator.
